SENTENCE.STRING: (Gujarati: વડોદરા, Hindi: बडोदा), pronunciation, also known as Baroda, is the third most-populated town in the Indian state of Gujarat after Ahmedabad and Surat.
is one of four towns in the state with a population of over 1 million, the other being Rajkot and the two cities listed above.
is located on the Vishwamitri river, southeast of Ahmedabad and
is known as the Cultural Capital of Gujarat.
is the administrative headquarters of the Vadodara District.
is home to almost 1.729 million people (as of 2005), the beautiful Lakshmi Vilas Palace and the Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda (M.S.U.)
which is famous for various departments, including the fine arts, performing arts, technology and medicine streams.
has a high literacy rate by Indian standards of 78% (2001).
Major industries include petrochemicals, engineering, pharmaceuticals, and plastics.
